intro: Hieracium bauhini subsp. megalocymophorum, commonly known as the giant meadow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and it produces numerous seeds that are dispersed by wind. It is often considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its aggressive growth habit.
